intro: Myosotis annua var. versicolor, commonly known as the variable forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodland edges and meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its stems are upright and branching. The flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
